migration_plan.notes: Articles from Cultivate site to be migrated to Winzenburg.com with brand voice transformation

articles.title: 80% Faster Creatives: How We Use Glif to Batch-Generate Validation Assets
articles.excerpt: Most founders get stuck on 'we need 10 ad variants' and spend days in Canva. We batch-generate creatives with Glif, refine with Midjourney, and ship in hours.

articles.title: From Manual to Automated: How We Use Lindy AI to Execute Validation at Scale
articles.excerpt: Most founders manually manage waitlists and outreach. We automate execution with Lindy while keeping Cursor as our documentation system of record.

articles.title: Never Ship Outdated Code: How We Use Context7 to Query Live Documentation
articles.excerpt: Most AI code generation uses stale training data. We query live docs via Context7 MCP to ensure code suggestions match the latest version of every library.

articles.title: The AI Tool Stack: How We Coordinate 7 AIs Without Chaos
articles.excerpt: Using multiple AI tools sounds like a nightmare. Here's how we orchestrate Manus, ChatGPT, Claude, ElevenLabs, Midjourney, Glif, and Lindy with clear lanes and zero overlap.

articles.title: Brand-First Validation: Why We Design the Brand System Before Writing Code
articles.excerpt: Most teams bolt branding on at the end. We make it a pre-build artifact that informs every UI decision.

articles.title: The Complete Workflow: Discovery to Deployment in 2025
articles.excerpt: Our current end-to-end SaaS creation system, from validating ideas to shipping code—with 25 agents, 8 quality gates, and zero guesswork.

articles.title: The Dev Quality Assistant: Test Planning Before Code Touches the Repo

articles.title: Gamification That Doesn't Manipulate: Designing Habit Loops with Industry-Appropriate Mascots

articles.title: The Hub Evolution: From Static Docs to Real-Time Portfolio Intelligence

articles.title: The Kill/Greenlight Ritual: How We Stay Ruthless About Portfolio Quality
articles.excerpt: Most founders can't kill ideas because of sunk costs. We make tough decisions systematically, not emotionally, using weekly reviews and clear kill criteria.

articles.title: Micro-Interactions Done Right: Apple-Style Motion That Guides Without Distracting
articles.excerpt: Bad animations annoy. Great ones are invisible. Here's our playbook for refined, goal-driven micro-interactions.

articles.title: Personalization with Privacy: How We Design Adaptive UX That Respects Consent
articles.excerpt: Personalization can feel creepy. Here's how to make it thoughtful, transparent, and opt-in.

articles.title: The Rule Consolidation: How We Kept 40+ Rules Manageable Without Losing Power

articles.title: The Security & Bug Gate: Two-Tier Code Review for AI-Generated Features
articles.excerpt: AI can ship features fast, but it can also ship vulnerabilities. Here's our quality firewall.

articles.title: The Supabase MCP Blueprint: Production-Grade Backends in Minutes, Not Weeks
articles.excerpt: Backend design is usually trial-and-error. We turned it into a repeatable blueprint using Supabase MCP.
